intro: Paepalanthus planifolius var. major, commonly known as the giant marsh hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are broad and flat, contributing to its common name, while its stems are often reddish in color. This plant plays an important ecological role in its native environment by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
